p: In summary, convalescent plasma therapy holds promise as an emergency transient treatment for critical COVID-19 patients. Nevertheless, it is of utmost importance to emphasize that, unlike chemicals, such as hydroxychloroquine, which can only harm the individual taking them, plasma therapy can endanger entire communities. In scenarios of scarce blood-borne pathogen testing capacities, few enforced regulations, and widespread misinformation and disease stigma, unregulated convalescent plasma therapy may well become a recipe for a new HIV epidemic in the developing world.
